paper_abstract: As a development of the theory of linear error bounds for lower semicontinuous functions defined on complete metric spaces, introduced in Aze et al. (Nonlinear Anal 49, 643-670, 2002) and refined in Aze and Corvellec (ESAIM Control Optim Calc Var 10, 409-425, 2004), we propose a similar approach to nonlinear error bounds, based on the notion of strong slope, the variational principle, and the change-of-metric principle, the latter allowing to obtain sharp estimates for such error bounds through a reduction to the linear case.
paper_title: Nonlinear error bounds for lower semicontinuous functions on metric spaces
